intro: Diskyphogyne widgrenii, commonly known as the narrow-leafed phyllanthus, is a unique species belonging to the Phyllanthaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered leaves that are typically narrow and elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences, which are borne on short, hairy peduncles. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that split open to release tiny seeds. This plant is native to tropical regions and is often found in shaded, moist environments within its native habitat.
